model.name: Software
model.description: Class describing a software resource

model.name: Identity
model.description: Properties which assert the identity of BOM components in order to facilitate inventory management and risk association. Assertions may include a single occurrence of one or more identifier types assigned from different domains.

model.name: Local
model.description: Identifies a localized instance of a software, hardware, or data component with customized configurations and subsets of components from the distributed packaging.

model.name: Remote
model.description: An instance of software that must be retrieved, on-demand, at runtime

model.name: Type
model.description: An abstract classification of a reusable component that indicates its scope of use and assists with separation of concerns.

model.name: Dataset
model.description: Reference to dataset

model.name: Configuration
model.description: Reference to, or actual configuration supplied to the software

model.name: Source Code
model.description: Reference to, or actual source code

model.name: SBOM
model.description: Reference to an external Software Bill of Materials for the software

model.name: Media Type
model.description: A media type, also known as a MIME type, is an identifier used to communicate an intended data format.

references.title: RFC 6838: Media Type Specifications and Registration Procedures

model.name: Integrity
model.description: Values which can be used to verify the integrity of components

model.name: Hash
model.description: A unique numerical value which identifies the contents of a file after being processed through a cryptographic algorithm.

model.name: Release Notes
model.description: Documents that are distributed alongside the release of a component.

model.name: Release Type
model.description: Specifies the type of release including major, minor, patch, and pre-release

model.name: Title
model.description: The title of the release

model.name: Featured Image
model.description: An image that may be prominently displayed with the release note.

model.name: Social Image
model.description: An image that may be used in messaging on social media platforms.

model.name: Description
model.description: A short description of the release.

model.name: Timestamp
model.description: The date and time (timestamp) when the release note was created.

model.name: Aliases
model.description: One or more alternate names the release may be referred to. This may include unofficial terms used by development and marketing teams (e.g. code names).

model.name: Tags
model.description: One or more tags that may aid in search or retrieval of the release note.

model.name: Resolves
model.description: The defects, enhancements, and security issues that have been resolved.

model.name: Known Issues
model.description: Any outstanding defects, enhancements, and security issues known to exist.

model.name: Notes
model.description: Zero or more release notes containing the locale and content. Multiple note objects may be specified to support release notes in a wide variety of languages.

model.name: Locale
model.description: The ISO-639 (or higher) language code and optional ISO-3166 (or higher) country code.

references.title: Codes for the Representation of Names of Languages

model.name: Text
model.description: Specifies the full content of the release note.

model.name: Evidence
model.description: Provides the ability to document evidence collected through various forms of extraction or analysis.

model.name: Identity
model.description: Evidence that substantiates the identity of a component.

model.name: Field
model.description: The identity field of the component which the evidence describes.

model.name: Confidence
model.description: The overall confidence of the evidence

model.name: Method
model.description: The methods used to extract and/or analyze the evidence.

model.name: Technique
model.description: The technique used in this method of analysis.

model.name: Confidence
model.description: The confidence of the evidence. Confidence is specific to the technique used. Each technique of analysis can have independent confidence.

model.name: Value
model.description: The value or contents of the evidence.

model.name: Tools
model.description: The tool(s) used during the analysis

model.name: Occurrences
model.description: Evidence of individual instances of a component spread across multiple locations.

model.name: Callstack
model.description: Evidence of the components use through the callstack.

model.name: Licenses
model.description: Evidence of any and all licenses that were observed during analysis.

model.name: Copyrights
model.description: Evidence of any and all copyright statements that were observed during analysis.

model.name: Machine Learning
model.description: Class describing a machine learning resource

model.name: Model Parameters
model.description: Hyper-parameters for construction of the model.

model.name: Approach
model.description: The overall approach to learning used by the model for problem solving. This may include 'supervised', 'unsupervised', and other learning types.

model.name: Task
model.description: Directly influences the input and/or output. Examples include classification, regression, clustering, etc.

model.name: Architecture Family
model.description: The model architecture family such as transformer network, convolutional neural network, residual neural network, LSTM neural network, etc.

model.name: Model Architecture
model.description: The specific architecture of the model such as GPT-1, ResNet-50, YOLOv3, etc.

model.name: Datasets
model.description: Information about and location to the datasets used to train and evaluate the model.

model.name: Inputs
model.description: The input format(s) of the model

model.name: Outputs
model.description: The output format(s) from the model

model.name: Quantitative Analysis
model.description: A quantitative analysis of the model

model.name: Performance Metrics
model.description: The model performance metrics being reported. Examples may include accuracy, F1 score, precision, top-3 error rates, MSC, etc.

model.name: Considerations
model.description: The considerations that should be taken into account regarding the model's construction, training, and application.

model.name: Users
model.description: The intended users of the model

model.name: Use Cases
model.description: The intended use cases the model is designed to achieve.

model.name: Technical Limitations
model.description: The known technical limitations of the model. E.g. The kind(s) of data should the model be expected not to perform well on, and the factors that might degrade model performance.

model.name: Performance Tradeoffs
model.description: The known tradeoffs in accuracy and/or performance of the model.

model.name: Ethical Considerations
model.description: The ethical or environmental risks involved in the application of the model.

model.name: Fairness Assessments
model.description: How does the model affect groups at risk of being systematically disadvantaged? What are the harms and benefits to the various affected groups?

model.name: Hardware
model.description: Class describing a hardware resource

model.name: Identity
model.description: Properties describing the precise identity of hardware

model.name: Planning Bill of Material
model.description: Reference to a Planning Bill of Materials

model.name: Procurement Bill of Material
model.description: Reference to a Procurement Bill of Materials

model.name: Engineering Bill of Material (EBOM)
model.description: Reference to an Engineering Bill of Materials

model.name: Manufacturing Bill of Material (MBOM)
model.description: Reference to a Manufacturing Bill of Materials

model.name: Service Bill of Material (SBOM)
model.description: Reference to a Service Bill of Materials

model.name: Quantity
model.description: The total number of the specified component.

model.name: Function
model.description: The purpose of the component (Bluetooth, network, storage, microprocessor, connector, etc)

model.name: Location
model.description: The location on the board or related daughter-boards where the device exists.

model.name: Device Type
model.description: The type of component such as SMD, thru-hole, etc

model.name: Lot Number
model.description: Lot or batch identification for the component

model.name: Production Timestamp
model.description: Production timestamp for the component

model.name: MAC Address
model.description: Hardware address for network interfaces

model.name: Certifications
model.description: Certifications

model.name: Country Code
model.description: ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 country code of a certifying authority

model.name: Authority
model.description: Abbreviation of the certifying authority (e.g. FCC, UL, and CE)

model.name: Authority Identifier
model.description: Identifier for radio components.

model.name: Authority URL
model.description: URL to certification details.

model.name: Service
model.description: Class describing a service resource

model.name: Identity
model.description: Properties describing the identity of the service

model.name: Provider
model.description: The provider of the service

model.name: Name
model.description: The name of the service

model.name: Version
model.description: The version of the service

model.name: Description
model.description: A description of the service

model.name: Authentication
model.description: Class describing the authentication parameters required by the service

model.name: Protocols
model.description: The authentication protocols supported by the service

model.name: Factors
model.description: The multiple factors supported by the service

model.name: Data
model.description: Class describing the data

model.name: Classifications
model.description: The data classifications supported by the service

model.name: Flow
model.description: The directional flow of data to and from the service

model.name: From
model.description: The source pushing inbound data to the service

model.name: To
model.description: The destination that the service pushes data to

model.name: Configuration
model.description: The configuration supplied to the service

model.name: SBOM
model.description: Reference to an external Software Bill of Materials for the service

model.name: Identifiers
model.description: Properties which assert the identity of BOM components. Assertions should include a single occurrence of one or more identifier types assigned from different domains.

model.name: Common Platform Enumeration (CPE)
model.description: CPE is a structured naming scheme for information technology systems, software, and packages. Based upon the generic syntax for Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI), CPE includes a formal name format, a method for checking names against a system, and a description format for binding text and tests to a name. The CPE standard and official dictionary are maintained by NIST.

model.name: Coordinates
model.description: The namespace, name, and version of the resource. The namespace (or group) is part the coordinates for the resource ecosystems that support it.

model.name: Package URL
model.description: A URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programing languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

model.name: SWID
model.description: ISO/IEC 19770-2 Software Identification (SWID) tags

model.name: Name
model.description: name as defined in the SWID SoftwareIdentity element

model.name: Version
model.description: version as defined in the SWID SoftwareIdentity element

model.name: Tag ID
model.description: tagId as defined in the SWID SoftwareIdentity element

model.name: Tag Version
model.description: tagVersion as defined in the SWID SoftwareIdentity element

model.name: Patch
model.description: patch as defined in the SWID SoftwareIdentity element

model.name: Software Creator Name
model.description: name of the entity with a role of softwareCreator

model.name: Software Creator Reg ID
model.description: regid of the entity with a role of softwareCreator

model.name: Tag Creator Name
model.description: If the tag creator is different from the software creator, tagCreatorName should be specified

model.name: Tag Creator Reg ID
model.description: If the tag creator is different from the software creator, tagCreatorRegId should be specified

model.name: Serial Number
model.description: A serial number is a unique identifier assigned to an item.

model.name: SKU
model.description: A stock-keeping unit (SKU) is a unique identifier used by retailers and wholesalers to identify and track inventory.

model.name: GS1
model.description: GS1 Standards

model.name: EPC RFID
model.description: Electronic Product Code - RFID (EPC Tag Data Standard)

model.name: GIAI
model.description: Global Individual Asset Identifier (GIAI)

model.name: GLN
model.description: Global Location Number (GLN)

model.name: GMN
model.description: Global Model Number (GMN)

model.name: GTIN-8
model.description: Global Trade Identification Number (GTIN-8 / EAN/UCC-8)

model.name: GTIN-12
model.description: Global Trade Identification Number (GTIN-12 / UPC-A)

model.name: GTIN-13
model.description: Global Trade Identification Number (GTIN-13 / EAN/UCC-13)

model.name: GTIN-14
model.description: Global Trade Identification Number (GTIN / EAN/UCC-14 or ITF-14)

model.name: License
model.description: Grants permission to use a resource under agreed-upon terms and conditions.

model.name: License Identifier
model.description: An identifier that uniquely identifies a specific license.

model.name: License Name
model.description: The name of the license

model.name: License Text
model.description: The textual content of the license.

model.name: License Header
model.description: An abbreviated snippet of the full license text often found at the top of source code.

model.name: License URL
model.description: The URL to where the full text of the license can be found.

model.name: Licensing
model.description: Licensing details describing the licensor/licensee, license type, renewal and expiration dates, and other important metadata.

model.name: Licensor
model.description: The individual or organization that grants a license to another individual or organization

model.name: Licensee
model.description: The individual or organization for which a license was granted to

model.name: Purchaser
model.description: The individual or organization that purchased the license

model.name: Purchase Order
model.description: The purchase order identifier the purchaser sent to a supplier or vendor to authorize a purchase

model.name: License Type
model.description: The type of license(s) that was granted to the licensee

model.name: Last Renewal
model.description: The timestamp indicating when the license was last renewed. For new purchases, this is often the purchase or acquisition date. For non-perpetual licenses or subscriptions, this is the timestamp of when the license was last renewed.

model.name: Expiration
model.description: The timestamp indicating when the current license expires (if applicable).

model.name: Ancestors
model.description: The lineage describing how components are related. Ancestors describe the origin component in which a component is derived.

model.name: Descendents
model.description: The lineage describing how components are related. Descendents describes a component that is derived from an origin component.

model.name: Variants
model.description: The lineage describing how components are related. Describes an ancestral relationship where the precise lineage is not known

model.name: Dependency
model.description: Direct and transitive relationships that specify when a resource requires another resource

model.name: Assembly
model.description: A list of software and hardware components included in other component. This is not a dependency tree, rather, assemblies provide a way to specify a hierarchical or exploded representation, similar to system → subsystem → parts assembly in physical supply chains.

model.name: Issue Tracker
model.description: Issue or defect tracking system, or an Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) system

model.name: Bill of Materials
model.description: Bill-of-materials (SBOM, OBOM, HBOM, SaaSBOM, etc)

model.name: Mailing List
model.description: Mailing list or discussion group

model.name: Chat
model.description: Real-time chat platform

model.name: Documentation
model.description: Documentation, guides, or how-to instructions

model.name: Support
model.description: Community or commercial support

model.name: Distribution
model.description: Direct or repository download location

model.name: Distribution Intake
model.description: The location where a component was published to. This is often the same as "distribution" but may also include specialized publishing processes that act as an intermediary

model.name: Security Contact
model.description: Specifies a way to contact the maintainer, supplier, or provider in the event of a security incident.

model.name: Attestation
model.description: Human or machine-readable statements containing facts, evidence, or testimony

model.name: Threat Model
model.description: An enumeration of identified weaknesses, threats, and countermeasures, dataflow diagram (DFD), attack tree, and other supporting documentation in human-readable or machine-readable format

model.name: Vulnerability Assertion
model.description: A Vulnerability Disclosure Report (VDR) which asserts the known and previously unknown vulnerabilities that affect a component, service, or product including the analysis and findings describing the impact (or lack of impact) that the reported vulnerability has on a component, service, or product.

model.name: Exploitability Statement
model.description: A Vulnerability Exploitability eXchange (VEX) which asserts the known vulnerabilities that do not affect a product, product family, or organization, and optionally the ones that do. The VEX should include the analysis and findings describing the impact (or lack of impact) that the reported vulnerability has on the product, product family, or organization.

model.name: Pentest Report
model.description: Results from an authorized simulated cyberattack on a component or service, otherwise known as a penetration test

model.name: Static Analysis Report
model.description: SARIF or proprietary machine or human-readable report for which static analysis has identified code quality, security, and other potential issues with the source code

model.name: Dynamic Analysis Report
model.description: Dynamic analysis report that has identified issues such as vulnerabilities and misconfigurations

model.name: Runtime Analysis Report
model.description: Report generated by analyzing the call stack of a running application

model.name: Component Analysis Report
model.description: Report generated by Software Composition Analysis (SCA), container analysis, or other forms of component analysis

model.name: Maturity Report
model.description: Report containing a formal assessment of an organization, business unit, or team against a maturity model

model.name: Certification Report
model.description: Industry, regulatory, or other certification from an accredited (if applicable) certification body

model.name: Quality Metrics
model.description: Report or system in which quality metrics can be obtained

model.name: Codified Infrastructure
model.description: Code or configuration that defines and provisions virtualized infrastructure, commonly referred to as Infrastructure as Code (IaC)

model.name: Pedigree
model.description: Data which describes the lineage for which software has been created or altered. Pedigree includes the ancestors, descendants, and variants which describe component lineage from any viewpoint and the commits, patches, and diffs which make a component unique. Maintaining accurate pedigree information is especially important with open source components whos source code is readily available, modifiable, and redistributable.

model.name: Commits
model.description: The commit information made to version control systems which document the alterations made to a component

model.name: Diffs
model.description: The comparison between two components which describe the alteration delta

model.name: Resolves
model.description: The purposes for modifying a component as documented in an Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) system or issue tracker

model.name: Enhancement
model.description: The ALM ticket describing additional features or capabilities in a modified component

model.name: Defect
model.description: The ALM ticket describing the defects that have been corrected in a modified component

model.name: Security
model.description: The ALM ticket describing the security changes that have been made in a modified component

model.name: Provenance
model.description: The traceability of all authorship, build, release, packaging, and distribution across the entire supply chain. Provenance may include individual and community authorship of software components, manufacturers, suppliers, software repositories, and country of origin. For high assurance applications, provenance plays an important role in determining Foreign Ownership, Control, or Influence (FOCI).

model.name: Storage
model.description: A network locatable service that stores artifacts

model.name: Package Repository
model.description: A service that stores software packages using a formal structure

model.name: Arbitrary Repository
model.description: A service that stores data objects

model.name: BOM Repository
model.description: A service that stores Bills of Materials

model.name: Version Control System
model.description: A category of software tools that records changes made to files by keeping track of all modifications

model.name: Ecosystem
model.description: An ecosystem of components that add extra functionality to core installation functions

model.name: Role
model.description: The purpose an entity plays in the supply chain

model.name: Supplier
model.description: The organization that supplied the component. The supplier may often be the manufacturer, but may also be a distributor or repackager.

model.name: Organizational Entity
model.description: Corporate entities, companies, foundations, and other structured and formally recognized organizations

model.name: Non-Organizational Entity
model.description: Non-corporate entities such as individuals

model.name: Manufacturer
model.description: The entity that built the software

model.name: Organizational Entity
model.description: Corporate entities, companies, foundations, and other structured and formally recognized organizations

model.name: Non-Organizational Entity
model.description: Non-corporate entities such as individuals

model.name: Publisher
model.description: The entity which makes available the software for public distribution

model.name: Organizational Entity
model.description: Corporate entities, companies, foundations, and other structured and formally recognized organizations

model.name: Non-Organizational Entity
model.description: Non-corporate entities such as individuals

model.name: Author
model.description: The entities who contributed to writing the software

model.name: Organizational Entity
model.description: Corporate entities, companies, foundations, and other structured and formally recognized organizations

model.name: Non-Organizational Entity
model.description: Non-corporate entities such as individuals

model.name: Chain of Custody
model.description: Chain of custody over time

model.name: Transparency Log
model.description: See https://securitytrails.com/blog/what-are-certificate-transparency-logs for examples

model.name: Formulation
model.description: A collection of formulas, each describing how a component or service was manufactured or deployed.

model.name: Formula
model.description: Describes how a component or service was manufactured or deployed. This is achieved through the use of formulas, workflows, tasks, and steps, which declare the precise steps to reproduce along with the observed formulas describing the steps which transpired in the manufacturing process.

model.name: Components
model.description: Transient components that are used in tasks that constitute one or more of this formula's workflows

model.name: Services
model.description: Transient services that are used in tasks that constitute one or more of this formula's workflows

model.name: Workflows
model.description: List of workflows that can be declared to accomplish specific orchestrated goals and independently triggered.

model.name: Tasks
model.description: The tasks that comprise the workflow.
